titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn U.S.A. View-Master images V1982.009
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-09-13T14:30-0400

did.abstract: Images show the Brooklyn Bridge, New York Naval Shipyard (commonly known as the Brooklyn Navy Yard), Ebbets Field, Brooklyn Botanic Garden, and the Prospect Park Zoo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains 21 color View-Master stereoscopic images, dated 1956, from View-Master's Vacationland Series, titled Brooklyn U.S.A. Images show the Brooklyn Bridge, New York Naval Shipyard (commonly known as the Brooklyn Navy Yard), Ebbets Field, Brooklyn Botanic Garden, and the Prospect Park Zoo.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn U.S.A. View-Master images, V1982.009, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Items in this collection may fall under copyright protection. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of John D. Morrell, date unknown.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.
